title: As a Tester, I want to access the Transactions API through the ebis link interface
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in with an account with ebis-link view permissions (club admin test accounts all have this permission)

General API Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Shared+Requirements
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Utilities > Ebis Link
custom_expected:
THEN the following endpoints are available, and each one is able to return data without an error
- All Transactions (returns all transactions, no parameters needed)
- All transactions for a given PlayerId (found in the URL of a player profile)
- All Transactions updated between two dates (requires a date range to be entered into the query field in this format: fromDate=MM/DD/YY%2008:00%20AM&toDate=MM/DD/YY%2005:00%20PM)
- Transactions by ID (Transaction ID can be found in the URL when viewing a transaction)


- AND They should also see the returned API response in a readable JSON format (with indents)
- AND The UI will have a basic Expand and collapse feature

title: As a club, I want information returned for an Optional Assignment transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club 

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Transactions+-+Optional+Assignment
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Transactions+-+General+Characteristics
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Utilities / Ebis Link
custom_expected:
THEN

* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for a given player ID
* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for a given transaction ID
* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for all transactions modified/added within a given date range
* Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
* Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
* Only information for Approved or Reversed transactions should be included in the API
* Since this is a MJ transaction, the transactions should only be available via the feed once they have appeared on a transaction bulletin that has been sent to the Clubs (see General Characteristics wiki for examples).
* Data in the response must exactly match data on the UI for the transaction.
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a club, I want information returned for a Declare Minor League Free Agent transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Transactions+-+Declare+Minor+League+Free+Agent
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Transactions+-+General+Characteristics
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Utilites / Ebis link
custom_expected:
THEN

* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for a given player ID
* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for a given transaction ID
* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for all transactions modified/added within a given date range
* Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
* Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
* Only information for Approved or Reversed transactions should be included in the API
* Since this is a MN transaction, the transactions should only be available via the feed after 5:00 PM ET on the day they were approved (see General Characteristics wiki for examples).
* Data in the response must exactly match data on the UI for the transaction.
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a club, I want information returned for the Level of Play Lookup
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Lookups
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Utilites / Ebis link
custom_expected:
THEN

* Many of the other feeds (player profile, contracts, etc.) contain IDs/codes, so the feed users will need to be able to lookup those codes to find more information about what they stand for.  For example, Org ID 21 is NYY/New York Yankees.
* Club user must be able to retrieve lookup info for all records modified/added within a given date range
* Club user must be able to retrieve lookup info by passing in ID (e.g. Org ID, Club ID, etc.)
* Club user must be able to determine if any lookup records were physically deleted from a table
*Level of Play Lookup is returned and matches the currently stored values per the requirement. 
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a Tester, I want to access the MLBPA Waivers API through the ebis link interface
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as test_mlbpa_link@mlb.com / h.f)MrO9bf8H*S6f}2v

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=EBIS&title=EBIS+2.5+Testing+accounts
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to 

https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/utilities/rest-client 

by manually entering the URL (replace the "ebisqa" with "ebisdev," "ebisstg" etc. when testing in different environments)
custom_expected:
THEN 

* Testers have a basic UI to select the MLBPA Waivers endpoint, and to supply input parameters
* They should also see the returned API response in a readable JSON format (with indents)
* The UI will have a basic Expand and collapse feature
* The UI should allow the tester to login with an API credential

title: As a MLPA User, I want Waiver Result data returned through an API
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as test_mlbpa_link@mlb.com / h.f)MrO9bf8H*S6f}2v

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=EBIS&title=EBIS+2.5+Testing+accounts


Requirements:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Feed+Requirements+-+Waivers+for+MLPA
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates directly to

https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/utilities/rest-client

by manually entering the URL (replace the "ebisqa" with "ebisdev," "ebisstg" etc. when testing in different environments)

Notes: jbancamper [11:02 AM]
so this endpoint returns the previous 9 days of Waiver Request bulletins
starting from Friday return the previous 9 days
if it’s not a Friday it will go to last week Friday and return the days
so what you have to do
run a Waiver Request Bulletin in DEV? today and tmrw you should see it in the endpoint

Go Into Waivers Menu in the env. you are testing
Find a date or dates no more than 9 days before current date that has data and click the Send Notification button
If there are no days with data on the Waivers page, then you can add data by:
1. selecting a date (no more than 9 days before)
2. Select and Org
3. Click Edit button
4. Add 1 player at a time and select a different Type for each player (max 3 players so you cover each type)

The next day you should see results when you run this MLBPA query
custom_expected:
THEN

* There are no parameters for the user to enter
* Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
* The API will be updated once a week: Friday at 4pm
* The API will only include data for 9 days (Friday + 8 prior days)
* Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
* Data in the response must exactly match data on the in the Waiver Bulletin reports for the same time period.
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a MLPA User, I want Roster data returned through an API
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as test_mlbpa_link@mlb.com / h.f)MrO9bf8H*S6f}2v

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=EBIS&title=EBIS+2.5+Testing+accounts

Requirements:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Feed+Requirements+-+Waivers+for+MLPA
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates directly to

https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/utilities/rest-client

by manually entering the URL (replace the "ebisqa" with "ebisdev," "ebisstg" etc. when testing in different environments)
custom_expected:
THEN

* There are no parameters for the user to enter
* Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
* The API will only include data displayed on Rosters
* The API will only include data for 4-2 days prior
  -- On Monday, the rosters for Thursday, Friday, and Saturday will be returned.  On Tuesday, the rosters for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday will be returned.  On Wednesday, the rosters for Saturday, Sunday, and Monday will be returned.  Etc.
* Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
* Data in the response must exactly match data on the Major League Rosters reports for the same time period.
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a MLPA User, I want Transaction data returned through an API
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as test_mlbpa_link@mlb.com / h.f)MrO9bf8H*S6f}2v

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=EBIS&title=EBIS+2.5+Testing+accounts

Requirements:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Feed+Requirements+-+Waivers+for+MLPA
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates directly to

https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/utilities/rest-client

by manually entering the URL (replace the "ebisqa" with "ebisdev," "ebisstg" etc. when testing in different environments)
custom_expected:
THEN

* There are no parameters for the user to enter
* Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
* Only transactions included on the Transaction Bulletin will be returned
* The API will only include data for 3 to 1 days prior
   -- On Monday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday's bulletins will be returned.  On Tuesday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday's bulletins will be returned.  Etc.
* Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
* Data in the response must exactly match data on the in the Transaction Bulletin reports for the same time period.
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a User, I want the MLBPA Waivers Batch Tied to the Sending of the Waiver Bulletin
custom_preconds:
Business Value:
 - Users do not want the MLBPA Waivers batch to run until the Waivers Bulletin is sent on Fridays
custom_steps:
AC:
 - Once the Waivers Bulletin is sent out on Fridays, the MLBPA Waivers Batch will run automatically
 - The batch will not automatically run until the Bulletin is sent out
 - The batch can still be run manually
